qas.question: What were National Guard members considered before 1903?
In what year did the Milita Act take place?
The Air Defense Artillery is a branch of what?
National Guardsmen are under the authority of who?
What was the U.S. Navy considered before 1903?
In what year did the Milita Act disband?
What is the State Defense Artillery a branch of?

context: Currently, the army is divided into the Regular Army, <a2_0><b6_0>the Army<b6_0/><a2_0/> Reserve, and the Army National Guard. The army is also divided into major branches such as Air Defense Artillery, Infantry, Aviation, Signal Corps, Corps of Engineers, and Armor. Before <b5_0>1903<b5_0/> members of the National Guard were considered <a0_0><b4_0>state soldiers<b4_0/><a0_0/> unless federalized (i.e., activated) by the President. Since the Militia Act of <a1_0>1903<a1_0/> all National Guard soldiers have held dual status: as National Guardsmen under the authority of <a3_0><b7_0>the governor<b7_0/><a3_0/> of their state or territory and, when activated, as a reserve of the U.S. Army under the authority of the President.
